entry.title: How to retrieve planned order details after conversion to a production order?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, after converting a planned order into a production order, the planned order object seems to be deleted, and its information is no longer visible.

I would like to confirm whether there is a way to retrieve the planned order conversion details, mainly to verify when the conversion took place and which user performed it.

Thanks and regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to retrieve planned order details after conversio...
entry.content:
This is the standard system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

When a planned order is converted into a production order, the system deletes the planned order and creates a new production order record. The original planned order data (such as creation date or user) is therefore no longer available in standard applications.

However, you can identify when and by whom the conversion was performed by checking the corresponding production order details:

Steps:

  1. Open the Change Production Order app.
  2. Search for the relevant production order created from the planned order.
  3. Go to the Administration tab.
  4. In the Creation section, you will find:
    - Created On - Date and time when the production order was created (which corresponds to the planned order conversion time).
    - Created By - The user who performed the conversion.

These fields provide the equivalent information about the planned order conversion.

entry.title: Re: SAP tables (SE16) for the transaction: S_P99_41000111
entry.content:
Table KEKO is the cost estimate header table, with basically 1 record per material, plant, costing date, costing version, and costing variant (through the valuation variant in the primary key).

Table KEPH has the various cost component raw amount fields numbered KST###.  There's 1 record per KEKO record, plus a split between local and group currency, and between total cost of the components (so potentially 4 records per KEKO record) and the columns are the costs of the components or components of the children (such that if your program takes the difference between those costs, you'll have the single-level costs of the manufactured material).

Table TCKH3 allows mapping the various KST### fields from KEPH-KST### into the cost component group numbers.

entry.title: Re: SAP TRM Migration to Public Cloud ‚Äì Cash Flow Transac...
entry.content:
Good day @ktemma 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Treasury and Risk Management, Migrate Data Using Staging Tables, Treasury Workstation

To summarise, in public cloud, the Migration Cockpit supports only specific TRM master and transactional objects. However, Cash Flow Transaction/Facility objects are not yet released as standard migration objects in the S4H Cloud Migration Cockpit. They only exist in the on-prem and private cloud editions. They are excluded from the public cloud because of the

  • Dependence on custom valuation areas and cash flow structure tables.
  • Restrictions imposed by the clean-core and simplified TRM data models in public cloud.

Note that SAP‚Äôs current roadmap (see SAP Roadmap Explorer ‚Äì Treasury 2025) shows plans to extend migration coverage to Cash Flow-based instruments in future public editions.

My experience is to proceed with standard TRM objects using the Migration Cockpit, whilst you handle Cash Flow Transactions either:

  • As a manual post-migration entry or
  • as reference data through CBOs or SAC/Datasphere.

LSMW is not supported in public cloud and therefore cannot be used.

Below is a clean-core migration step when you handle Cash Flow Transactions as a manual post-migration entry.

Go to Migrate Your Data app

On the screen, click create --> Migrate Data Using Staging Tables. Give the Project a name and click Create Project. The system will take you to the Migration Object Selection screen.

Choose your suitable TRM Option --> Review --> Create Project.

Next step is to handle Cash Flow Transactions. They are not one of the standard migration set, make sure you use one of the following compliant options:

Open Custom Business Objects app

Create a CBO called YY1_TRM_FacilityData.

Add fields: FacilityID, BusinessPartner, Currency, Amount, StartDate, EndDate, Status. Upload the historical facility data here. Use Custom Analytic Queries to report or reconcile with TRM positions.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: What's new in SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
SAP Logistics Management is our new solution in Supply Chain Management that combines warehousing‚ÄØand transportation management‚ÄØto streamline your operations‚ÄØwith network-centric collaboration. As mentioned in the previous What's New article, we are committed to delivering innovations continuously on a bi-weekly basis. 

In this blog post, you will learn about the new features in SAP Logistics Management that have been released this week. 

 

Business logging for goods receipt posting

With this feature, you can view and analyze logs related to the process of posting goods receipts to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. The logging functionality provides insights into the following aspects:

  • Determination of the logical system and BTP destination.
  • Technical parameters used for the posting process.
  • Material document number generated in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition upon successful posting.
  • Various reasons for unsuccessful postings, such as authorization failures or connection issues.

This complements the existing functionality, accessible via the App Monitor Business Logs.  

 

Cancelation of logistical demand

You may use this feature to cancel the processing of a logistical demand. The outcome of the cancellation depends on the current processing status: for logistical demands with errors,  since processing has not yet started, the document is removed from this application and deleted from SAP Logistics Management.

Cancellation of the logistical demand is supported via the app Monitor Logistical Demands: 

The result is displayed in the business log (App Monitor Business Log)

 

Reverse possibilities within manage pickup and deliveries

In this scenario, it is possible to reverse the process via the App Manage Pickups and Deliveries at different stages: check-in, loading completed, or check-out. When a reversal is performed, the system rolls the status back to an earlier stage. For instance, if the current status is check-out, it can be reverted to loading completed, or even further back.

Special case: In an LTL scenario without consolidation cut-off, the consignment is only created when status "Loading Completed" is reached. If the loading status is reversed, then the consignment is set to status cancelled.

The various reversal options are also available through the micro process flow in the list report: 

 

Enhancements for landing page on SAP Build WorkZone

In the course of continuously improving the user experience, we provide some enhancements to the landing page: 

  • enablement of side bar for navigation: new icons have been created in order to increase usability of the side bar navigation. To enable side bar, the menu option "Side" has to be selected in the Site Studio of SAP Build WorkZone.  Once enabled, this is applied to all users in this tenant. 
  • re-arrangement of  apps in spaces
  • changed appearance of warehouse task integration card: we changed the integration card "Confirmed Warehouse Tasks" on the landing page to a bar chart. 

          

 
Required action: update content package
In order to activate changes to the integration cards, perform the following steps to update the content package:
  1. Download the latest content package file from SAP Note 3605828.
  2. Open the Site Manager for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.
    To access the Site Manager, you need the LaunchpadAdmin role in the SAP BTP cockpit.
  3. Choose Channel Manager.
  4. Find the content package and choose the Update content action in the Actions column.
  5. Upload the downloaded content package file and choose Update.

 

Semi-automated maintenance of handling unit dimensions at packing work center

With this feature we enhanced the Packing Work Center to reduce manual data entry when working with shipping handling units.
  • Automatic dimension pre-fill: Dimensions are now automatically populated from the packaging material master data when creating a shipping handling unit. This eliminates repetitive manual entry for standard packaging materials like boxes, containers, and crates.
  • Automatic weight reset: The weight field is automatically reset whenever items are packed or unpacked from a handling unit, ensuring the user is prompted to verify the current weight and preventing outdated data.

     

 

Improved visibility of relevant process steps and new field in transportation request and consignment

If a process step is not relevant for a particular process, it is now displayed with reduced opacity in the apps Manage Transportation Requests and ‚ÄúManage Consignments.  This allows the user to better identify the relevant process steps:

Furthermore, in both apps (Manage Transportation Requests and ‚ÄúManage Consignments, )  a new field, the "Shipping Point", has been added. The new field can be found in the view settings: 

 

Display of Local time zone for locations with freight request for tendering and freight quotation in SAP Business Network for Logistics Freight Collaboration

So far, UTC was used per default as time zone. With this enhancement, the local time zone per location is displayed for the carriers in SAP Business Network for Logistics Freight Collaboration: 

 

Address details for business partner

As we are continuously fine-tuning our existing user interfaces, we introduced a popover to display the address details for the business partner in the app Display Business Partners: 

 

All these features have been deployed today and are available in the SAP Logistics Management tenants. We are happy to hear your feedback about the latest enhancements. 

‚ÄÉ

Further Information

SAP Logistics Management Product Page

SAP Logistics Management Learning Session

entry.title: Re: What is SAP's vision on "assignment types" in LMS
entry.content:
Hi @emanuelvynck 

Thanks for the question, and for the thoughtful feedback.

When we designed ILX, our research identified the key details users need on assignment cards to complete work successfully. Because card space is limited and customer needs vary, we prioritized the most common, high-value elements that serve the broadest set of organizations.

Based on feedback like yours, we‚Äôre making two near-term improvements:

  • Quick View on cards: Clicking a card will open a lightweight panel with additional details such as assignment type, description, and thumbnail images.

  • Search on ‚ÄúView All‚Äù pages: A new search field will help users find assignments faster.

Both updates are on our short-term roadmap. We appreciate your input as it‚Äôs directly shaping our next iterations. Thank you!

Neha Dhawan.

entry.title: Employee replication with inactive cost center assignment
entry.content:
Currently we have implemented Org and Employee replication from SuccessFactors to S/4 Hana mini master.  We had a company restructure and during that restructure the finance department has locked all their old cost centers as of 01/01/1900.  Now when replication occurs on rehires the s/4 system errors out saying

Cost center 1000/50004309 blocked against direct postings on 02/14/2023

I asked for finance to utilize validity periods for their cost centers, for our company that is not currently an option. This occurs in both SFEC and S4 (cost centers are passed to SFEC from S4 with the inactivation date of 01/01/1900 when locked)

1- Is there a work around, BADI, anything I can do on the HR side to stop the errors and complete replication for positions and employees in S4?

2- Are there any options in SuccessFactors to be able to edit on retro entries in job portlet with inactive cost centers.

Thank you for any advice.

entry.title: Re: Variable Pay - Can Assigment Details section to have...
entry.content:
@Laura_Gyselbrec 

See #2 below from this post.

Release tip and tricks for Compensation experts that need to do a cutover from a preview environment to a production environment by November 14-15 when 2H 2025 gets rolled out to Production environments:

  1. Configuration Transport Center will not work for MDF objects transport due to release version differences, it will only for business rules. MDF will need to manually recreated.
  2. In order to successfully import a compensation or variable pay template xml to production you will need to first search in the exported template from the preview environment for [hideInProfile="false" hideInForm="false"] and replace with blanks (through xml editor) otherwise you will get error messages in provisioning (the error message might not be specific to this but this is the root cause).

entry.title: Re: Custom report based on Material Classification
entry.content:
Hello @Dinesh_158 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Manage Product Master Data, App Implementation: Custom Analytical Queries, App Extensibility: Run Statutory Reports

To summarise, there is no standard analytical report that displays classification characteristics directly from the Material Master Classification data in public cloud. However, you can develop a Custom Analytical Report using standard in-app extensibility tools without needing to impact transaction data (PO, GRN, etc).

The classification data in public cloud is in I_ProductClassBasicData and I_ProductCharacteristicValue CDS views, which can be consumed for reporting through the Custom CDS View and Custom Analytical Querry apps.

There is no requirement for classification fields to appear in transactional data such as PO or GRN to build the report. You only need to use the correct join between Product and Classification views.

The following steps provides Clean-Core compliant Approach.

Search Custom CDS Views

Create a new CDS View, e.g., YY1_ProductClassReport √† Choose Primary Data Source = I_ProductBasicData

--> Add an Associated Data Source = I_ProductCharacteristicValue to bring in Classification details.

Join Product --> Classification Tables. Join on product= Product field. Expose the desired fields, Save and publish the view.

Search for Custom Analytical Queries

Create a new query based on your CDS View YY1_ProductClassReport. Select characteristics such as Material, Brand, Colour, and Category as dimensions. Add Material Group or Plant as filters if you need.

Preview the report and publish it as a Custom Fiori Appy using Custom Analytical Reporting or Custom Tiles. The report will now be visible to authorized busine roles.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Error during creation of business partner from ARIBA...
entry.content:
Good day @Sudharmv 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Integrating SAP Ariba SLP with S/4HANA Public Cloud Using SAP Master Data Integration

Business Partner Integration, SAP Ariba Integration scenarios with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system

In summary, the error your encounter occurs when the Business Partner Function setup expected by Ariba SLP integration is not aligned with the public cloud partner determination configuration. Unlike Private Cloud or On-prem systems, in the public cloud, table-based partner determination is not accessible or customisable. All partner logic is handled through configuration apps and business roles under SSCUI and communication arrangements. The error indicates that Ariba is trying to post a supplier record with a partner function that is not yet active or mapped correctly in your integration scenario.

The public cloud clean-core provides compliant resolution steps.

Go to Communication Arrangements

--> search for SAP_COM_0053

Check that the arrangement is active and the communication user has Business Partner Integration authorisations.

Next, open Manage Your Solution app. Go to Configure Your Solution √† Application Area: Sourcing and Procurement. Open the configuration step: Define Partner Determination Procedure for Supplier. Ensure that Partner Function VN is included in the active Partner Determination Procedure used by your Supplier Account Group.

Verify Account Group and Partner Schema Assignment. Make sure your supplier account group and purchasing document type both references the correct partner schema containing VN

Ensure that Ariba‚Äôs Supplier role SUPL maps to S4H role FLVN00 or FLVN01. The partner function VN must exist in the mapping.

Re-trigger the supplier replication from Ariba after corrections and monitor the status in Application Interface Framework. If the message shows green, then replication was successful.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: "Money" and "Date" format display according to "Locale" in Statements
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm looking for some clarification regarding how Money and Date formats are displayed in Compensation Statements.

Our template is configured as LocalCurrencyCentric, but for some currencies (for example, Hungary ‚Äì Saudi Arabia), the locale-specific format doesn‚Äôt seem to appear correctly in the employee statement.

=> Does anyone know where to find the list of supported locales for Compensation Statements?

Additionally, in the Design Worksheet, our EffectiveDate field is defined as a DateTypeField using the formula below:

toDate(lookup('WTZ_effectivedate', cust_coun, 1), 'MM/dd/yyyy')

However, the displayed date format in the statement doesn‚Äôt seem to follow the employee‚Äôs locale.

=> Does anyone know which format is actually applied by the statement rendering engine?

Finally, is there any SAP table or mapping that links these elements?

  • Tool Language
  • Currency
  • Date Format
  • Money Format

Thanks in advance for your insights!

SAP SuccessFactors Compensation @xavierlegarrec

entry.title: Re: Transport the GL account with implementation status "...
entry.content:
Good day @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Chart of Accounts in S/4 HANA Public Cloud (Cloud ERP), Chart of Accounts, SAP Note 3332309

Transportation Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2408

To summarise, in public cloud, G/L accounts with implementation status Do Not Use are part fo SAP delivered content. These accounts exist in configuration templates (e.g., Replace Account Symbols, Substitute Account Symbols, Valuation Keys, etc.) but are not active and therefore not transported to test or production systems. The reason is, it enforces the clean core principle and protects you from accidentally transporting SAP-delivered configuration objects tied to inactive or obsolete G/L master data.

However, public cloud provides a clean core compliant resolution options. Let us go through one of those:

Go to Manage G/L Account Master Data

Identify the account and not its Do not Use status (Demo Screnshot has Statu= in process)

Instead of modifying SAP content, create a copy of the G/L account: (45050990 used in screenshot for reference purpose)

Maintain the same account group field status variant. Go to Manage your solution √† Finance √† Configuration Activity. Define Account Symbol Substitution. Replace the obsolete account with your active copy. This ensures a clean, transportable configuration aligned with the public cloud restrictions.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to Register Lot Items on Physical Inventory Count Sheets During Cycle Counting
entry.content:
Hi

 

When performing a cycle count using the Job Scheduling and Mass Processing - Physical Inventory App  only lot-managed items cannot be registered.

 

The following error occurs:

====================================================================

TG21 0000000003  with stock type 1 already exist(s)

Message no. M7702

Diagnosis

You have already included the specified stock in the physical inventory document.

System Response

The system can include a certain stock in a physical inventory document once only.

Procedure

Make sure your entries are correct.

If necessary, change the material number. the batch number or the stock type, or delete the superfluous item.

================================================================

I have never registered a physical inventory count slip for this item and this lot.

Yet I get a contradictory error. There's nothing I can do about it.

 

Is there a solution?

entry.title: Re: Need to update HSN code in PR/PO during creation from...
entry.content:
Good day @Sudharmv 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Integration with SAP Ariba, Treasury and Risk Management (TRM)

About integration to support the packaging information for handling units in ship notices from Ariba Network

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Connected with SAP Ariba Applications

To summarise, in public cloud, when you integrate SAP Ariba Guided Buying with public cloud procurement, the system supports the creation of Purchase Requisitions that can later be converted into purchase Orders through Automatic Purchase Order Creation app.

In regard to HSN/SAC (BR_NCM) not being available in the PR UI or payload from Ariba Guided Buying is expected in public cloud. The HSN Code is a localisation-specific field that is not mapped in the Ariba PR-to-S/4 payload because Guided Buying does not handle India tax classification fields directly. It is not introduced at PO item level under the India localisation tab.

In public cloud, the standard intergration flow follow: Ariba Guided Buying √†Purchase Requisitions √† Automatic Purchase Oder Creation. You cannot skip PR creation and create Pos directly from Ariba GB. That scenario is only available in AB and Invoicing integrated with On-Premise or Private Cloud systems.

You can consider a clean core solution option to maintain the HSN/SAC (BR-NCM) in the Material Master data under:

Manage Product Master data

Choose the product you want to maintain.

In View: choose India Localisation / Tax Data. Field: HSN Code (BR_NCM)

When the PR is converted into a PO, the system automatically derives BR_NCM from the material record into the PO India tab.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How can I view [EVB7575663]
entry.content:
reference attachment [Case],
CASE#DIGITS/DIGITS has been closed. I need to view and report on this incident [EVB7575663].
How can I query [EVB7575663]?
If my account has insufficient permissions, how can I obtain viewing permissions for [EVB7575663]?


--- Support Assistant ---
Users
Standard S-user ID
S-user Management

Q: Which S-user is having issue now?
A: PERSON_NAME.feng.pan.wg@fujifilm.com
Q: What issue does the above S-user have?
A: None of the above

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can I view [EVB7575663]
entry.content:
The logic for event notifications is that an S-user first needs to subscribe to the notifications for that product, and only then will they receive the relevant notifications. Since the occurrence time of this event is in August, subscribing to the product now will not allow you to receive notifications related to the event EVB7575663. Therefore, you can only view it in the availability tab via link https://me.sap.com/event/EVB7575663/overview after your S-user have full authorizations.

Thus please follow below steps : 

  1. At first, please contact your super/cloud admin to ask for relevant authorizations in the screenshot. You may click the "request authorization" button or search for your super/cloud admin in https://me.sap.com/userscontacts/impcont and send an email to them.
    Related KBA 2587408 - S-user ID authorizations for Cloud Availability and Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications (Get Notified) - SAP for Me 
  2.  However, considering that you may still need to check relevant event notifications in the future, I suggest you contact your super or Cloud admin to help you subscribe to the product's notifications.  
    Related KBA 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: How to download WBS element or WBS element overview r...
entry.content:
Good day @erobaga 

 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Project Control,   Project Control - Enterprise Projects, Project Financials Control

To summarise, in public cloud, there isn‚Äôt a single ‚ÄúWBS Element export‚Äù report like in on-premise because the public cloud version uses Fiori analytical apps instead of classical SAP GUI. However, there are several standard, clean-core compliant ways to export WBS elements to Excel. You do not need to use migration templates.

Let‚Äôs take a look at one of them

Search for Project Control-Enterprise Projects app.

In the overview, select the project you want to analyse.

Under the Structure tab, you can see all WBS elements associated with that project. Export to Spreadsheet. This will download all visible WBS elements, Project IDs, descriptions etc. to an Excel file. This is the recommended clean-core way to export WBS data.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Notification User list for CDG
entry.content:
Hi karthikeyan,

Based on your description, I understand you would like to obtain a list of users who have enabled subscriptions for your cloud systems. If this is correct, you can view the user list via the Get Notified application by following these steps:

  1. Navigate to: https://me.sap.com/systemsprovisioning/getNotified
  2. Select "Manage Subscriptions"
  3. Ensure "By Subscription" is selected
  4. Navigate to and click on the cloud services you wish to verify, users who have subscribed to notifications will then be displayed.

For detailed information, please refer to 2548400 - Getting started with the SAP Cloud Availability - SAP for Me

If you have any further questions or require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out. I am here to help.

Have a nice day !

Kind regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: how to adjust depreciation amount after complete transfer
entry.content:
How to adjust the depreciation amount so the monthly depreciation amount is the same after complete transfer?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: how to adjust depreciation amount after complete tran...
entry.content:
Hi Community,

The depreciation is calculated only as per the period control configuration corresponding to the type of transaction and the posting date of the transaction. For the complete transfer, as it's a daily depreciation based depreciation method, the depreciation is calculated from the date of posting of the complete transfer and not from the depreciation start date.

In order to manually adjust the amount, you may kindly refer to the help document below to check if there are any manual adjustment suitable for your business scenario. 

Help doc:<Manual posting in fixed asset>

 

Best Regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Mass reset and reversal function for Clearing documents
entry.content:
We have a scenario where in we need to reset and reverse multiple clearing documents.  Ex:  We need to cancel a payment document and reprocess the payment (if payment is rejected by the bank).  Then A/P team needs to cancel each tax tax entry first for each invoice in the payment and there is no option to do mass cancellation.  Team must reset and reverse each and every document manually one after other. 

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Mass reset and reversal function for Clearing documents
entry.content:
Use 'Reset Cleared items (FBRA)' app to reset the clearing documents identified in step1.  You can only reset one document.

This is in accordance with the standard system design

See kba 2682947  Mass reset in Fiori app Reset Cleared Items (App ID F2223)

To reverse Invoices created in FI See app Manage Journal Entries, for same mass reversal is possible.

entry.title: Add 'Net Due Interval 4' field in the 'Aging Grid of journal entry view of Account Receivables'
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Standard Fiori Application - Aging Grid of journal entry view of Account Receivables, have total 3 filters/parameters as 'Net Due Interval 1', 'Net Due Interval 2' and 'Net Due Interval 3'  which have default values as 30, 60 and 90 respectively.

Is it possible to add a new filter as a 'Net Due Interval 4' which will be having default value as 120 (editable)? (as shown in below screenshot)

My Observation - What I observed is, the existing fields 'Net Due Interval 1, 2 and 3 are coming from the underlying Interface CDS view - P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid1 . And by taking reference of 'Net Due Interval 1, 2 and 3', if we add the new field 'Net Due Interval 4' in this interface view by extending it then we have to add this field in all the other Interface Views and final consumption view also. Below are those standard cds views which needs to be extended to accommodate the new field 'Net Due Interval 4' - 

1) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid1 --> 1st Interface view to be extended 
2) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid2 
3) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid3 --> Here need to update the existing logic to calculate 'NetDueInterval' field with respect to 'Net Due Interval 4'
4) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid4 --> Need to update the logic for fields 'Net Due Interval Amount 1, 2, 3 & 4' because 'NetDueInterval' (which is calculated in above cds view) is used in the calculation of those amount fields.
5) I_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid --> This is Cube View
6) C_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid --> This is Final Consumption view or Analytics Query View

Also I have observed that, the existing AR Aging report is giving correct result when I enter value 120 days in the 'Net Due Interval 3' for my requirement to calculate for 120 days interval.

Now, please guide -->

1) Is it possible to add 'Net Due Interval 4' field in the standard AR Aging Report?

2) If YES, then please validate my above observation i.e. we have to extend total 6 standard CDS views to add this new field.

3) In views 'P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid3' and 'P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid4' --> we have to update existing logic to calculate 'NetDueInterval' and 'Net Due Interval Amount 1, 2, 3 & 4' respectively. Is this is correct i.e. to update existing fields logic while doing CDS Extend?

4) If No, then shall we proceed by entering 120 days in 'Net Due Interval 3' which is giving us the correct the result?

Note - My system is S4HANA on Premise >> Release 2021 .

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Re: Timestamp to DATS (with user timezone) in Custom CDS...
entry.content:
Hi,

S/4 Public Cloud help page (08.2025) regarding Custom CDS View App mentions a limited list of functions which may give an incorrect idea of the app's capability.  I've come to realize that we can use all ABAP CDS functions for calculations. 

For calculating Date or Time from Timestamp (DEC 15), we can use the following:

Date: tstmp_to_dats( <timestamp>,  <timezone>, <client>, <on_error>)

Time: tstmp_to_tims( <timestamp>,  <timezone>, <client>, <on_error>)

We can use following values for timezone, client, on_error

Timezone: abap_system_timezone( $session.client, 'NULL' )

Clinet = $session.client

on_error = 'NULL' 

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Cloud Foundry Runtime in SAP BTP Trial shows 0 MB mem...
entry.content:
Hi,

Please check the link for similar issue

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/btp-cloud-foundry-consumed-by-all-spaces-exceeds-any-running-applications/qaq-p/14181547

Snippet from it.: Even though the application is stopped, tasks can still be running. We had to run command cf tasks APP-NAME for each app in the CF org. For one of the apps that was stopped, so we didn't think it would have been an issue, there were a series of tasks that were in status RUNNING and each task is consuming 1GB of memory. We're investigating why the task was not finishing successfully but we determined we can cancel the task. 

To cancel the task run command cf terminate-task APP-NAME TASK-ID. 

Afterwards, this cleared the memory consumption issue. 

Regards,

Prithviraj

entry.title: Re: I got the Dump when i Hit the BAPI Approve the Data f...
entry.content:
Hi

Please check sap note 2351694 - How to activate PPO and resolve ASSERTION_FAILED dump during synchronisation, which talks on a similar issue. I hope this helps.

If it doesn't work, try debugging the process.

Regards,

Prithviraj

entry.title: Master Blog: SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite Migration ‚Äì Tool and Guidance
entry.content:
Migration Journey Overview: From Assessment to Tooling

Migrating from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite represents a significant milestone in your organization‚Äôs cloud transformation journey. This master blog serves as a central hub for comprehensive information and guidance related to the Migration Tool and the broader migration process. It provides links to detailed blogs, documentation, and best practices to help you successfully plan and execute your migration to SAP Integration Suite.

Before beginning any migration activity, it‚Äôs crucial to start with the Migration Assessment - a key capability of the SAP Integration Suite. The assessment analyses your on-premises landscape, including existing integration configurations, mappings, custom adapters, and dependent objects. It provides detailed insights and a comprehensive overview indicating which scenarios can be migrated as-is, which ones require optimization, and which may need to be redesigned or modernized. This step establishes a clear, data-driven foundation for a successful and efficient migration journey.

Once your Migration Assessment is complete, the next big step is moving your integration content to the cloud - and that‚Äôs where the Migration Tool comes into play!

The Migration Tool, built into SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs Cloud Integration capability, helps you bring your existing integration scenarios from SAP Process Orchestration to the cloud with ease. Think of it as your Guided workflow for migration - it identifies what can be moved, converts integration artifacts into their cloud-ready counterparts, and helps you streamline the entire process with minimal manual effort.

Migration Tool ‚Äì Offerings and Supported Components

The Migration Tool comes packed with a set of features to make your move from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite smoother and faster. Here‚Äôs an overview of the key components it supports and automates.

Connectivity to On-Premise Systems: Choose the appropriate connection setup for securely linking your on-premise landscape with the SAP Integration Suite. For detailed configuration options, see Configuring Connectivity to an SAP Process Orchestration System

Object Types: The tool supports migration of integration artifacts such as Integrated Configurations, which define how messages are processed within the Java-only runtime of SAP Process Orchestration systems.

It also supports Receiver Determination, which is available in SAP Process Integration dual-stack installations (from release 7.5 onwards) where message processing takes place on both ABAP and Java stacks.

 

Patterns: The Migration Tool supports a variety of integration patterns to help you transition your existing scenarios to cloud-ready designs. These patterns provide flexibility for different integration needs - whether it‚Äôs point-to-point communication, content-based routing, or complex orchestration flows.

For the complete list of supported patterns, refer to the Migration Patterns

Migration Approaches: The Migration Tool offers two approaches - Standard Approach and Pipeline Approach to help you move your integration scenarios efficiently to the cloud. For more details, see Pipeline Concept

 

Communication Channels: The Migration Tool helps move your existing communication channels to the cloud, making sure your integration endpoints and related settings are mapped correctly. A few exceptions may apply, so some channels might need minor adjustments after migration. For more details, see Standard Adapter Migration.

Adapter Module Support: The tool automatically migrates PGP encryption and decryption modules to cloud-compatible configurations. Additional adapter modules are provided through the community package and can be leveraged as needed. The following list provides an overview: Adapter Modules

Decoupling and Ordered Message Processing with JMS Queues: The Migration Tool supports JMS queue configurations to enable decoupled communication between senders and receivers. In SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration, internal JMS Adapter help separate asynchronous message processing from the sender, allowing messages to be handled independently and reliably.

To ensure messages are processed in the correct order - EOIO, the Access Type should be set to Exclusive, which ensures that only one consumer/worker processes messages from the queue at a time.

Note: This configuration is not applied automatically by the Migration Tool and must be set manually.

Idempotent at Receiver: The tool also provides idempotent message handling at the receiver side. This means it helps prevent duplicate message processing, ensuring that each message is delivered and processed only once - an essential feature for maintaining data consistency.

Reusing Artifacts for Efficient Migration: The Migration Tool provides options for users to reuse existing standalone artifacts - message mappings and function libraries, to their migrated scenarios. This flexibility allows message mappings and other artifacts to be reused across multiple integration scenarios, reducing redundancy and speeding up the migration process.

Example: Enable Reusable Artifacts

 

Migration Summary: After the migration, a detailed summary report provides an overview of all successfully migrated Integration Flow Configurations and their related objects in the cloud. If any object could not be migrated, this information is clearly highlighted in the summary, helping you identify follow-up actions easily.

The Migration Tool does offer a downloadable Summary Report that captures essential migration details - including the on-premise system details, integration patterns used, chosen migration approach, and other key information related to each migrated object, which you can review later if required.

Note: If you‚Äôd like to select an alternative runtime profile instead of the default Cloud Integration, you can manually set it in the Integration Runtime configuration the successful migration of the Integration Flow.

Error Logs: When the Migration Tool cannot migrate to certain integration scenarios, it generates a detailed error log summary. This log provides insights into the specific issues encountered, helping you understand what went wrong and take corrective actions.

Hint: The error log is available to download as a .csv file. You can import it in Excel and use a delimiter as Comma (,) to transform the data, to review and analyse the migration errors effectively check columns ‚ÄòStatus‚Äô and ‚ÄòMessage‚Äô.

 

For detailed, step-by-step instructions on using the Migration Tool, refer to the official tutorial: Use the Migration Tooling

 

Known Limitations of the Migration Tool

While the Migration Tool covers a wide range of integration scenarios, there are some known gaps and limitations. For the most up-to-date information, refer to Known Limitations of Migration Tooling 

Disclaimer: The list of gaps and limitations may shorten as SAP expands coverage and implements features on its roadmap

 

Next in the Series

Stay tuned for the upcoming posts where we will dive deeper into specific migration scenarios, tips, and best practices to help you get the most out of SAP Integration Suite.

 

References - SAP Documentation and Blogs:

Migration Guide for SAP Process Orchestration

Get Started with Migration to SAP Integration Suite

Assessment Blog: How to use the Migration Assessment Application to get ready to migrate your SAP Process Orchestration Scenarios?

Migration Tool: Migration tool in Cloud Integration Capability of SAP Integration Suite
